;;海洋探索号游轮上有两名乘客感染新冠病毒，该游轮被困在格陵兰岛阿尔卑斯峡湾国家公园内。
;

;据船上一名澳大利亚乘客称，一艘在格陵兰岛阿尔卑斯峡湾国家公园搁浅的游轮上有两人感染了 Covid-19，但每个人都保持着“良好的精神状态”。

;

;这艘澳大利亚运营的游轮周一，载有 206 名乘客和船员的海洋探索号在格陵兰首府努克东北约 1,400 公里处的国家公园游览时搁浅。

;

;这艘 104m 长的船于 2017 年从挪威出发。 9 月 1 日一直持续到 9 月 22 日，周二涨潮未能将其解救后，该船仍被困住。

;

;然而，丹麦当局表示，一艘科学渔船定于周三晚些时候抵达，并将尝试在涨潮时将海洋探索者号拉出。

;

;“一艘在国家公园遇到麻烦的游轮显然令人担忧。最近的救援地点很远，我们的部队也很远，而且天气可能非常不利，”丹麦海军北极联合司令部司令布赖恩·延森 (Brian Jensen) 中校在周二的一份声明中表示。
;
;“但是，在这种情况下， “根据具体情况，我们没有看到对人类生命或环境造成任何直接危险，这令人放心。”他补充道。

;

;运营该船的澳大利亚极光探险公司表示，所有乘客和船员都已安全。安全的。据信，许多乘客是澳大利亚人，还有来自新西兰、英国、美国和韩国等其他国家的游客。

;

;“我们正在积极努力解救MV海洋探索者号从其接地开始。我们最重要的承诺是确保船只在不影响安全的情况下恢复。”奥罗拉 (Aurora) 说。

;

;与丈夫一起在船上的澳大利亚人吉娜·希尔 (Gina Hill) 表示，他们感到一阵颤抖，然后当船搁浅了。

;

;她说，乘客们精神状态良好，正在聆听船员们的讲座和探险故事。 .

;

;“似乎没有人害怕，他们定期向我们提供最新情况，”希尔说。

;

;希尔说，机组人员告诉乘客，另外两名乘客乘客感染了新冠病毒，他们已被隔离。她说，一些乘客选择在公共区域戴口罩，但其他乘客则没有。

;

;阿尔卑峡湾位于覆盖世界上最大岛屿的冰盖对面，坐落在格陵兰岛的一个偏远角落，一些乘客选择在公共区域佩戴口罩。距离最近的定居点 Ittoqortoormiit 240 公里，距离该国首都努克近 1,400 公里。

;

;丹麦北极联合司令部的弗莱明·马德森上尉告诉美联社，乘客和机组人员状况良好，“我只能说，他们获得了终生难忘的经历”。

;

;;美联社和路透社的补充报道。;

;
;;欧盟委员会主席乌苏拉·冯德莱恩 (Ursula von der Leyen) 周三在欧洲议会发表讲话。
;

;乌尔苏拉·冯德莱恩 (Ursula von der Leyen) 表示，欧盟必须立即为乌克兰和其他国家成为欧盟成员所需的彻底变革做好准备。

;

;在她的年度;“国情咨文”演讲，欧盟委员会主席警告成员国需要“配合乌克兰和其他国家的决心”做好准备扩大欧盟。

;

;“我们不能让我们的欧洲同胞落后，”冯德莱恩在明年欧盟选举周期开始前的最后一次国情咨文演讲中说道。

; < p>;有 ;随着乌克兰和其他国家排队加入，欧盟准备好扩大了吗？;

; ;

;冯德莱恩表示，欧盟扩张的关键是预算增加、集团资助的内容以及资助方式，以及“可信的安全承诺”，提及有关乌克兰申请加入北约的辩论。

;

;“这些是我们今天必须解决的问题如果我们想为明天做好准备，”她说。

;

;扩大欧盟的关键问题之一是高效的法律。个别成员可以否决某些提案，如果欧盟规模扩大，那么就更难达成一致。

;

;这些规则的改变可能需要对欧洲条约进行调整——这需要在诸如此类的国家进行全民公投

;

;冯德莱恩表示，成员国不应等待在国内进行这些辩论。

;

;“我们不能也不应该等待条约修改来推进扩大， ”她说，并补充说，欧洲议会议员需要开始解决“由 30 多个国家组成的联盟如何在实践中运作的实际问题”;。;

;

;27 个成员国集团可能会扩大到36 或 37 个国家，有 9 个国家在排队，其中一个是格鲁吉亚，正在迈向加入的道路上。 “我相信欧洲队也能在 30 岁以上工作。”冯德莱恩说。

;

;她反驳了欧洲理事会主席查尔斯·米歇尔设定 2030 年加入欧盟最后期限的呼吁，称加入欧盟必须以择优为基础，并且需要深化与东欧和西巴尔干国家的政治关系。

;

;除非有关关键变革的辩论在欧盟各国首都展开，否则欧盟可能会陷入乌克兰已完成入盟改革但欧盟尚未加入的尴尬境地。尚未准备好让该国成为成员国。

;

;冯德莱恩重申欧盟支持乌克兰对抗俄罗斯，并誓言“只要需要”就支持基辅。

;

;她的演讲回顾了她作为欧盟委员会主席第一任期的亮点，同时也是制定未来目标的机会，欧洲议会选举将于明年六月举行。

;

;中国占主导地位这场长达 20 页的演讲贯穿了她在电动汽车、半导体和太阳能电池板等关键原材料领域的地位。

;

;在她迄今为止最强烈​​、最具体的讲话中，在电动汽车领域，冯德莱恩发出含蓄警告，称欧盟不会容忍中国在欧洲市场上倾销低价电动汽车。

;

;凭借对关键化合物氢氧化锂供应的控制，欧盟不会容忍中国向欧洲市场倾销低价电动汽车。在电动汽车电池领域，中国对宝马、大众、菲亚特和标致等欧洲汽车制造商构成巨大威胁。

;

;中国企业集团比亚迪在 6 月份推出了两款电动汽车，行业预测中国汽车销量将达到 80 万辆冯德莱恩在演讲中表示，全球市场“充斥着更便宜的中国电动汽车”，这些汽车的价格“因巨额国家补贴人为压低”。她补充说，这扭曲了“我们的市场”，是欧盟“不会接受的”。

;

;冯德莱恩宣布对中国电动汽车进行反补贴调查，并表示：“欧洲对竞争持开放态度，而不是为了逐底竞争。”

;

;但她也证实了业界对政治走钢丝的担忧。冯德莱恩表示：“与中国保持开放的沟通和对话渠道同样至关重要。”她指的是欧盟“去风险”而不是与北京“脱钩”的正式政策。

;

;她的警告向中国发出的也是迄今为止最强烈​​的暗示，表明欧盟委员会将屈服于英国和欧盟汽车制造商的要求，暂停对欧盟内电动汽车出口征收 10% 的关税，以允许德国、法国、意大利、英国和中欧工厂赶上冯德莱恩在制定未来 100 天的立法目标时还谈到了人工智能带来的威胁和机遇，表示欧盟领导人有一个“缩小的机会之窗”来引导

;

;她表示，她的首要任务之一是在未来 100 天内通过欧盟关于人工智能的立法，该立法目前已进入最后阶段。

; Wed, 13 Sep 2023 21:22:02 +0800 France halts iPhone 12 sales over radiation exposure levelshttps://www.theguardian.com/technology/2023/sep/13/france-halts-iphone-12-sales-over-radiation-exposure-levels
;;2023-09-13T12:35:38Z;
;
;;法国里尔的一家 Apple 专卖店。
;

;Apple 面临销售禁令可能会在法国召回 iPhone 12，因为这家美国公司对有关智能手机超出国家监管机构射频暴露限制的报告提出质疑。

;

;苹果周三表示，其 iPhone 12 已获得多个国际机构的认证符合全球辐射标准，对法国 ANFR 监管机构的测试提出异议，该测试称该型号发射的电磁波容易被人体吸收，超出了允许的范围。

;

;该监管机构表示，它已经发现了这款手机的特定吸收率（ SAR）（衡量人体从设备吸收射频能量的速率的指标）在模拟手机握在手中或放在口袋中的测试中为每公斤 5.74 瓦。在此类测试中，欧盟的 SAR 标准为 4.0 瓦/千克。监管机构指出，该手机符合其最近对 141 部手机进行的多项其他 SAR 测试。

;

;;ANFR 周二表示;将派遣特工我们向苹果专卖店和其他经销商核实该机型是否已不再销售，该机型于 2020 年 10 月推出，最近已下架。该监管机构表示，预计苹果“将采取一切可用手段来制止违规行为”，如果不采取行动，将导致召回已售给消费者的 iPhone 12 手机。

;

;苹果该公司表示正在与监管机构合作，并已提交多个内部和独立实验室结果，显示这些设备符合所有全球 SAR 法规和安全标准。该公司在其网站上发布了其设备的 SAR 值，;包括 iPhone 12;。

;

;许多国家的监管机构对手机可能发出的电磁辐射量有各种限制，以防止对健康造成不良影响。手机的合规性测试是通过人为地将其所包含的各种无线电设置为最大广播强度，并在大量测试中测量输出来模拟手持或裤袋、包或夹克中以及直到头部进行携带的情况。来电。结果显示了手机在最严酷的操作条件下可以达到的上限，并不代表典型使用情况。

;

;世界卫生组织在其网站上表示，经过大量研究， “尚未确定使用手机对健康造成任何不利影响。”。

;

;法国数字经济部副部长让-诺埃尔·巴罗特 (Jean-Noel Barrot) 表示，软件更新足以解决辐射问题链接到电话。他在周二晚间接受《巴黎人报》采访时表示：“苹果预计将在两周内做出回应。如果他们不这样做，我准备下令召回所有流通中的 iPhone 12。这个规则对每个人都是一样的，包括数字巨头。”

;

;ANFR 表示：“如果苹果选择更新其手机，则应经过 ANFR 的验证。”巴罗特表示，法国监管机构现在将把调查结果转交给其他欧盟成员国的监管机构，这“可能会产生滚雪球效应”。

;

;不过，苹果并未按国家或型号细分其销量。报告的收入和分析师的估计使欧洲成为该公司仅次于美洲的第二大销售地区。

;

;销售禁令的消息传出时，苹果 ;宣布推出最新的 iPhone 15 机型;，采用通用 USB- C 充电连接器取代了该公司专有的 Lightning 连接器。这是 ;新的欧盟通用充电器法规;将于今年年底生效，这使得 USB-C 成为所有消费电子产品的通用连接器，从而使 iPhone 成为最后的抵制者之一。

;

;欧盟希望通用标准能够为消费者节省金钱，并减少因需要为不同电子设备购买单独的充电器和电缆而产生的电子废物。

;;威尔士球员在波尔多对阵斐济的橄榄球世界杯揭幕战前唱国歌。
;

;橄榄球世界杯组织者迫于压力，周三上午宣布计划在赛前重新录制国歌;在赛事开幕周末面临广泛的批评;。官员们还表示，新版本将得到参赛国家的批准。
;

;

;La Mêlée des Chœurs 是一个由 7,000 名来自不同背景的学童参与的项目，由合唱团在没有伴奏的情况下演唱各国国歌，但球迷的反应绝大多数是负面的。

;

;2023年法国世界杯主席雅克·里瓦尔在周三的赛事媒体吹风会上表示：“八场比赛后我们得到的反馈是这些国歌令人不安，或者让我们的粉丝感到惊讶。

;
;

;;相关：;;丹尼·西普里亚尼：“我不是一个特立独行的人。我是决策者” ;

;
;

;“我们来这里是为了优先考虑粉丝体验，我们对这种负面反馈感到非常担忧……这是一个相当敏感的问题，因为对于所有人来说对于团队来说，这是非常重要的一点。

;

;“今天我们提出了新版本、简化版本，同时保留了孩子们的声音，这些不同的版本不会......让支持者感到不安，并将提供更多肯定的音乐表演。”

;

;赛事总监 Michel Poussau 表示，将就新版本征求参赛国家的意见。 “我们知道它没有起作用，或者没有达到我们希望的效果，”他承认。 “我们可以制作更接近预期的国歌，但仍然会感受到这些孩子们的感动，我想说，他们非常出色，一直在努力工作，他们值得参加这次比赛。”;

;虽然组织者承认对国歌的批评并采取了行动，但他们拒绝对裁判和官员针对头部接触所实施的制裁所造成的普遍混乱发表评论。

;

;英格兰队的汤姆·库里 ;被禁赛两场;

;“毫不奇怪，裁判突然成为最困难的工作之一在这项运动中，”普绍说。 “我们的集体责任显然是通过始终支持裁判来尽可能让裁判的生活变得轻松，这就是我们在世界橄榄球联盟所做的事情。
;
;“我们知道我们拥有最好的球员在那个裁判团队中，我个人认为我不应该评论与球场和我们的裁判团队密切相关的决定。”

; Wed, 13 Sep 2023 20:22:01 +0800 ‘Farcical’: China’s media gives short shrift to British spying allegationshttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/sep/13/china-media-reaction-british-spying-allegations
;;2023-09-13T12:16:29Z;
;
;;中国和英国国旗
;

;两人在英国被捕的爆料所带来的后果自事件曝光以来，涉嫌为中国从事间谍活动的行为一直占据着英国新闻的头条。然而，在中国受到严格控制的媒体中，这几乎没有引起任何涟漪。

;

;国家控制的媒体花了一天多的时间才报道了这个故事，报道了中国大使馆的简短声明。伦敦，然后外交部发表评论。

;

;信息很简短：这些指控毫无根据，英国正在“炒作”它。周二，国家支持的鹰派小报《环球时报》发表了前编辑胡锡进的一篇社论，称这种情况“滑稽可笑”，并表示它强调了“衰落的大英帝国正在变得越来越偏执和肤浅”。

;

;周三，该媒体用中英文发表社论，询问英国是否试图复制“气球门”，指的是美国二月份在其领空击落中国间谍气球，就像两国一样各国开始修复关系。

;

;《环球时报》表示，英国的爆料“通常是小案子”，并指责一些议员炒作。声明称：“在美国和英国，有一些个人或势力专门破坏对华关系。”

;

;社交媒体上，评论者对这场争议漠不关心。 “在间谍方面，没有人……是干净的，”一位人士写道。更多的评论加入了另一项以英国为中心的媒体运动——呼吁归还大英博物馆的文物。

;

;《环球时报》虽然得到国家支持且大声疾呼，但它并不是官方喉舌。受到共产党严格控制的媒体，如新华社和《人民日报》，往往更多地关注领导层的议程、习近平最近的讲话和宣传活动——例如;对日本在福岛排放处理过的废水的持续负面报道; ，或谴责台湾政府的“分裂主义”。

;

;他们没有对英国间谍故事投入同样的精力，政府发言人反而坚持谈话要点。

; Wed, 13 Sep 2023 20:22:01 +0800 Twitter chaos after Elon Musk takeover may have violated privacy order, DoJ allegeshttps://www.theguardian.com/technology/2023/sep/13/twitter-elon-musk-takeover-ftc-order-data-security-privacy-doj-case

;
;;2023 年 7 月埃隆·马斯克将 Twitter X 更名为 Twitter X 后，一名工人在旧金山公司总部拆除 Twitter 的标志。;

;根据法庭文件，埃隆·马斯克 (Elon Musk) 收购 Twitter 在社交媒体平台上造成了“混乱的环境”，这可能违反了要求对其数据安全和隐私做法进行彻底改革的政府命令。

;
;;前 BP 首席执行官伯纳德·卢尼
;

;在前一晚发布令人震惊的公告后，周三 BP 股价下跌该公司首席执行官因承认未能充分详细说明与同事的关系而辞职。

;

;;伯纳德·卢尼 (Bernard Looney) 整个职业生涯都在这家石油和天然气跨国公司度过，他立即离开了这家价值 880 亿英镑的公司其任期还不到四年。

;

;英国石油公司周二晚间通知投资者，卢尼“没有提供所有关系的详细信息，并承认他有义务进行更完整的披露”。

; < p>;该公司股价周三上午在伦敦证券交易所开盘后下跌了 1.7%，随后收复了部分损失。

;

;BP 在一份声明中表示，董事会首先收到了指控“去年 5 月，在匿名消息人士联系后，“关于卢尼先生在与公司同事的个人关系方面的行为”。

;

;该公司和外部法律团队审查了这些指控，促使卢尼披露“在成为首席执行官之前，与同事的历史关系很少”。

;

;当时，BP 并未发现任何违反公司行为准则的行为。然而，该公司表示，其董事会“就披露过去的个人关系以及他未来的行为寻求并得到了鲁尼先生的保证”。

;

;在最近收到类似性质的进一步指控后，英国石油公司表示其外部法律顾问开始了调查，调查仍在进行中。

;

;BP 表示：“卢尼先生今天通知该公司，他现在承认自己在之前的披露中并不完全透明。”

; >;

;它补充说，鲁尼没有提供所有关系的详细信息，并承认他应该做出更完整的披露。

;

;“公司拥有强大的价值观，董事会希望公司的每个人都按照与这些价值观。英国石油公司表示，所有领导者都应该成为榜样，并以赢得他人信任的方式做出良好的判断。

;公司首席财务官 Murray Auchincloss 将负责运营该业务

;

;卢尼在爱尔兰的一个奶牛场长大，并于 21 岁时在都柏林学习电气工程后不久于 1991 年加入 BP。这位 53 岁的先生将继续在 BP 北海、越南和墨西哥的业务中担任职务，并于 2016 年接管其上游部门。

;

;他于 2020 年担任该公司的最高职位，并迅速制定了英国石油公司“到2050年或更早成为净零排放公司”的雄心壮志。卢尼承诺加强公司在低碳领域的业务，包括可再生能源和电动汽车充电。

;

;然而，他面临着来自投资者的压力，投资者希望 BP 专注于其石油和天然气业务，并且绿色活动家敦促公司更快地摆脱化石燃料。

;

;今年早些时候，卢尼在;缩减其气候雄心;，同时宣布年利润增加一倍多，达到 280 亿美元（230 亿英镑） 2022 年，乌克兰战争导致天然气价格大幅上涨，提振了该公司的收入。

;

;卢尼的薪酬在 2022 年增加了一倍多，达到 1000 万英镑 - 此举被标记为 ;为应对生活成本危机的消费者提供“有力的打击”;。

;

;他的薪酬包括 140 万英镑的工资、240 万英镑的奖金（比 2021 年略有下降）、600 万英镑的股票奖励以及福利。 This meant that the total package was 120% more than the £4.5m he received in 2021.

;

;BP said “no decisions have yet been made in respect of any remuneration payments to be made to Mr Looney”.

;

;The company added that any decisions, including any payments made to Looney for his resignation, would be disclosed when its annual accounts and reports were published.

;

;Looney's departure, first reported by the Financial Times, marks a changing of the guard at Britain's two largest energy companies. ;Wael Sawan; took over at BP's rival Shell in January.

;

;Looney “announced some bold intentions on taking over as CEO, with a pivot away from hydrocarbons and towards renewables”, said Biraj Borkhataria, an associate director of European research at RBC Europe. “The world has clearly changed since Bernard took over as CEO.

;

;“With Murray at the helm, we wonder if we could see a step back … to the future, with more focus on value and value growth in the core business.”

; Wed, 13 Sep 2023 18:52:02 +0800 Revealed: far-right venture capitalist has contracts with US for ammunitionhttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/sep/13/far-right-nate-fischer-ammunition-us-government-contract
;;2023-09-13T10:30:00Z;
;
;;United States flag formed out of bullets.
;

;A far-right figure who is involved in a secretive invitation-only fraternal organization, whose founder has spoken of being at war with the US government, is also part-owner of an ammunition company that has contracts with the federal government and law enforcement, the Guardian can reveal.

;

;Nathaniel Fischer – a venture capitalist, former Claremont Institute fellow and president of the Dallas lodge of the secretive Society for American Civic Renewal (SACR) – is also part-owner of Texas-based ammunition manufacturer S1 Armory, which trades as ;Stand 1 Armory;.

;
;

;;Related: ;;US businessman is wannabe 'warlord' of secretive far-right men's network;

;
;

;A Guardian investigation has revealed that the company has current US federal government and law enforcement contracts, even though Fischer regularly promotes anti-government conspiracy theories on social media.

;

;The Guardian contacted Stand 1 Armory and a gmail address associated with Fischer for comment but received no response.

;

;Fischer, 38, of Dallas, Texas, is also CEO of New Founding, described by him as a “venture fund for the American right”, which is now seeking wealthy investors for a venture fund that will power explicitly rightwing startups.

;

;Filings with the Texas comptroller of public accounts and IRS indicate that Fischer has been president of SACR's Dallas lodge since its founding in 2021.

;

;The Guardian reported ;last month; that the secretive, invitation-only fraternal organization was founded by former shampoo magnate, Charles Haywood, who has mused on his website about his possible future as a “warlord” at the head of an “armed patronage network” which might engage in “more-or-less open warfare with the federal government” in a post-collapse US.

;

;Following the Guardian's reporting, Haywood and SACR attracted broad criticism, ;including some; from others on the Christian right like Josh Buice, an Atlanta-based Baptist pastor.

;

;Dallas and Dallas county property records, data brokers and real estate websites indicate that the registered address for SACR's Dallas lodge is also Fischer's home address, a property owned on paper by a trust registered to the same address.

;

;The property is a 6,400 sq ft French Normandy-style house on a one-acre lot in Royal Northaven, one of Dallas's most exclusive neighborhoods. The city of Dallas valued the home at over $3.3m in its most recent assessment.

;

;Also registered at that address is S1 Armory LLC, whose Texas filings name Fischer as a general partner, along with Mary Kaufman of Fairview, Texas, and Jennifer Willimas of Weatherford, Texas.

;

;That company is an ammunition manufacturer located in Allen, Texas. It was founded in 2013 by Anthony Miglini but was bought in 2020 by Principal Investments, a private stock company ;reportedly; founded by Fischer.

;

;Federal government records indicate the company currently has two contracts to deliver ammunition to the US Department of Justice worth a total of ;$78,678;.

;

;On X, formerly known as Twitter, meanwhile, Fischer has repeatedly criticized the justice department and its agencies, and more generally expressed anti-government sentiments and aired anti-government conspiracy theories.

;

;Many of these comments concern the January 6 attacks at the US Capitol.

;

;In January 2022, Fischer wrote of accused rioters that “The way the DOJ is treating these political prisoners is disgraceful”. In the same month, he objected to Twitter's efforts to push back on disinformation claiming that federal agencies orchestrated those events, claiming “we don't know the extent of the FBI's involvement”.

;

;Other Fischer posts assert collusion between federal agencies, media and internet companies.

;

;In August 2022, in relation to allegations that Facebook censored the story of Hunter Biden's laptop during the 2020 election, ;he asked;: “Does the CIA handle foreign coups and the FBI domestic ones?” Last January, Fischer posed a “sincere question for institutionalists / pro-institutional conservatives … Is there a reason FBI agents who censored information that proved true … deserve anything more than contempt?”

;

;Fischer also appears to believe that federal agencies are involved in an ongoing effort to simulate far-right protests. Recently after neo-Nazi protests in Orlando, Florida, Fischer repeatedly endorsed the rightwing conspiracy theory that the protesters were federal agents, at one point responding to another poster, “We know that the Feds are trying to build a narrative that right-wing extremism is the greatest security threat we face.”

;

;Fischer has also repeatedly called for conservative US to secede in an act of “;national divorce;”.

;

;Laura K Field is a senior fellow at the Niskanen Institute who has written about the Claremont Institute and the political milieu surrounding it.

;

;In an email, she pointed to the “incoherence of Fischer's position”, writing that Fischer “is selling munitions to (and is presumably dependent on) government entities for whom he also shows great contempt”.

;

;Field added: “He is also stoking the culture war and pitching his wares to would-be vigilantes whom he hopes will turn on the government,” which she wrote is “altogether consistent with the Claremont Institute worldview, which is constantly fretting about civic disunity and the perils of multiculturalism, while at the same time actively stoking the flames of the culture war”.

;

;She concluded: “It's also so vivid and potentially violent – it's impossible not to imagine the vigilantes and the government entities shooting at one another using Fischer's munitions!”

;

;S1 Armory also has contracts with local law enforcement agencies in several states. ;Council meeting records; from Normal, Illinois, indicate that the city's police department paid the company $6,200 for ammunition in June 2022 and $2,580 in 2021; Amarillo Independent school district paid the company $1,545 in September 2022 according to its check register.

;

;Fischer has acted as a public representative for S1 Armory. In a video on the company published for the Align platform – which was subsequently bought from New Founding by Blaze Media – Fischer says that US gun culture is “an important lever against potential tyranny in our country”, and suggests that “when a guest comes over to a host's place, there should be a new norm of not bringing wine, they should bring ammunition”.

;

;Fischer is CEO of New Founding, which bills itself as a “venture firm and talent network”. Having sold its platforms Align and Return to Blaze Media last month, which also saw New Founding's co-founder Matthew Peterson move to Blaze Media as editor-in-chief, New Founding has launched a new venture fund which requires investors to pay $50,000 a quarter for a subscription, according to fund documents.

;

;Their funds will be invested in companies that “embody a distinct right-wing cultural thesis and/or provide technology or infrastructure that is strategically valuable to the right”, according to a ;post on X; from Santiago Pilego, a New Founding employee.

;

;The venture fund is not required to make extensive filings with regulators due to its size and remit, and it is not clear who has invested in it so far. However, Charles Haywood, the former shampoo maker and would-be warlord, retweeted Fischer's 21 August announcement of the fund.

;

;New Founding's earliest publicly-recorded income came from Firebrand Pac, a now defunct political committee whose main activities included producing a series of videos featuring the Claremont Institute's primary funder, Thomas Klingenstein, warning that conservatives were in a “cold civil war” with “woke communists”.

;

;Federal Election Commission records show that Firebrand Pac paid New Founding $382,500 in four disbursements between January and September 2022. The Guardian reported ;last month; that Klingenstein had become a far more active political donor since 2020.

;

;Fischer was a Claremont Lincoln fellow in 2020, in the same class as Breitbart tech reporter Allum Bokhari, and Michael Knowles, the Daily Wire pundit who ;told the Conservative Political Action Coalition conference last March; that “transgenderism must be eliminated”.

; Wed, 13 Sep 2023 18:52:02 +0800 ‘Sea is constantly dumping bodies’: fears Libya flood death toll may hit 20,000https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/sep/13/libya-flood-death-toll
;;2023-09-13T10:45:33Z;
;
;;A man sits amid the flood damage in Derna, Libya
;

;International aid is slowly starting to reach the devastated port city of Derna as an inquest starts into how as many as 20,000 people may have perished when ;Storm Daniel hit; the northern coast of Libya on Saturday night.

;

;Ten thousand people had been declared missing by official aid agencies such as the Libyan Red Crescent, but the new, ominous higher estimate of 20,000 deaths came from the director of Al-Bayda Medical Center, Abdul Rahim Maziq.

;

;Corpses still litter the street, and drinkable water is in short supply. Whole families have been wiped out by the storm and with the remoteness of some villages and the rudimentary nature of municipal government it will take time for the death toll to be confirmed.

;

;But the ;scale of devastation; appeared even worse than officials had initially predicted. The “sea is constantly dumping dozens of bodies”, said Hichem Abu Chkiouat, the minister of civil aviation in the administration that runs eastern Libya, adding that reconstruction would cost billions of dollars.

; ;

;The International Organization for Migration (IOM) in Libya said on Wednesday that at least 30,000 individuals were displaced in Derna, the town most affected by storm Daniel. IOM added that 6,085 were known to have been displaced in other storm-hit areas including Benghazi, with the number of deaths still unverified.

;

;Aid agencies have been battling to reach the town of just over 100,000 people. Hampered by the destruction of roads, helicopters were required, mainly provided by Egypt.

;
;

;;Related: ;;Libya flooding: before and after satellite images reveal scale of disaster in Derna;

;
;

;Aid is arriving from countries historically linked to Libya including Turkey, the United Arab Emirates and Egypt, where three days of mourning had been declared. But help in the form of trucks and doctors is being sent from the west towards the wast.

;

;The country has been politically divided for years. But the impression remains that the international emergency aid operation has been slow to spring into action with attention focussed on the earthquake in Morocco, and experts taking time to realise the scale of the disaster.

;

;France was sending a field hospital and about 50 military and civilian personnel able to treat about 500 people a day, Paris said on Tuesday.

;

;Political infighting in Libya has already started on how Derna was so exposed to the damage caused by Storm Daniel. Musa al-Koni, a member of the Libyan presidential council, said “it had not been expected that this hurricane would be this strong and destructive to this extent, especially since the country had not witnessed such devastating storms before”.

; ;

;Speaking on the Libya Al Ahrar channel, he said: “We dealt with the crisis without plans, and it is clear to the public what happened. We want everything to be done to the maximum and fastest, and now we do not have time to blame each other, and we must work as much as we can. None of us were exposed to what our people were exposed to in Derna, and it is natural for us to blame our institutions.”

;

;Maj Gen Ahmed al-Mismari, a spokesperson for the Libyan National Army, which dominates in the east, said its units acted within the first hours of the storm's arrival and carried out their duty to the fullest extent.

;

;He said: “The Libyan people are patient and believe in fate and destiny, and what happened is God's destiny, and we do not hold anyone responsible at all, and we console ourselves, the Libyans, and Muslims with this number, which is likely to increase in the coming days, but people must adhere to the instructions issued.”

;

;Listing all the roads that had been closed, he added: “All the bridges in Derna had been vulnerable to these floods, and this created a challenge as all transportation routes were closed to us. We tried to find alternative routes, and every soldier must reach the citizen whatever the problem or dilemma was facing him.”

;

;He said Libyans were welcoming displaced families, and hotels and schools had been opened to provide accommodation as development agencies provided cover, medicines and humanitarian services amid the ongoing search and rescue mission.

;

;He said support was arriving by air and sea but added that there were people south of the Green Mountain about which little had been heard.

;
;;Storm clouds move over the Houses of Parliament in Westminster
;

;The Conservative party “acted swiftly” to block two potential parliamentary candidates from standing, after warnings from MI5 that they could be spying for China, a government minister has said.

;

;The health minister Maria Caulfield was speaking after it was revealed that the Tories dropped two potential candidates to become MPs after MI5 warned they had links to China's United Front Work Department, a body charged with influencing global policy and opinion.

;

;The Times reported that concerns were raised over the pair separately in 2021 and 2022. They were subsequently blocked from the central candidates list.

;

;Caulfield told Times Radio: “I think whichever party is in government, there will always be those who are trying to target it, either to get information or to influence.

;

;“The story that we have heard about today, about the candidates who the Conservative party were warned about, swift action was taken and they were removed from the list. They are not standing for election.

;

;“Any intelligence that comes forward, it just shows that we will take that very seriously, the same with the researcher in parliament.

;

;“It does show that there are other nations always wanting to infiltrate government of all parties. But we have shown that we take that seriously and act swiftly when that intelligence comes forward.”

;

;A Conservative party spokesperson said: “When we receive credible information regarding security concerns over potential candidates we act upon them.”

;

;A separate source said: “It was made very clear that they posed a risk. They were subsequently blocked from the candidates list. They weren't told why.”

;

;The reports come as the government faces questions over allegations of spying in Westminster after a parliamentary researcher was arrested on suspicion on spying for China and breaching the Official Secrets Act.

;

;Last month, James Cleverly became the first foreign secretary in five years to visit China and said during the visit that it would not be “credible” to disengage with Beijing.

;

;;The FT; said the prime minister, Rishi Sunak, was informed of the alleged spy's arrest in a “timely fashion”, soon after it took place in March, but still continued to step up engagement with Beijing.

;

;On Monday, MPs expressed fury over a six-month silence that meant they had been unable to take their own security precautions, amid wider concern that individual pro-democracy activists could be put at risk by any security lapse.

;

;Tim Loughton, a Conservative MP who has been previously sanctioned by China for criticising the country's regime, said no guidance had been provided to MPs by parliament's security authorities or by the Foreign Office or Home Office.

;

;Kirsty Blackman, an SNP frontbencher, asked why parliament only learned about the allegations from media reports over the weekend, and called for “a review into the decision-making process” as soon as possible.

;

;Responding directly to Blackman, Lindsay Hoyle, the Commons speaker, said “the MPs who needed to be told were told” at the time of the arrest, which had quietly taken place in March.

;

;The researcher, who is in his 20s, was arrested in Edinburgh at the same time as a second person, in their 30s. It is understood he had links to the Tory MP Tom Tugendhat, until he became security minister, and subsequently Alicia Kearns, who chairs the foreign affairs select committee.

;

;The parliamentary staffer has said he is “completely innocent” and had spent his career highlighting the “challenge and threats presented by the Chinese Communist party”. In a statement put out by his lawyer he said: ““It is wrong that I should be obliged to make any form of public comment on the misreporting that has taken place.“However, given what has been reported, it is vital that it is known that I am completely innocent.

;

;“I have spent my career to date trying to educate others about the challenge and threats presented by the Chinese Communist Party.

;

;“To do what has been claimed against me in extravagant news reporting would be against everything I stand for.”

;

;The arrest under the Official Secrets Act led to Sunak confronting the Chinese premier, Li Qiang, at the G20 summit on Sunday over what he described as an “unacceptable” interference in democracy.

;

;The prime minister is also facing growing anger among ministers over the government's refusal to label China as a threat to UK security despite the arrest of the researcher.
